title: UAW Workers Are Tilting in Favor of New Contract With GM
text:
Unionized workers at several major General Motors Co. factories have voted to back a proposed labor contract, an encouraging sign for United Auto Workers leaders under pressure to get a deal approved and end a six-week nationwide strike.

A majority of UAW-represented workers in Flint and Lansing, Mich.—where GM has massive manufacturing operations employing more than 6,000 blue-collar workers—cast ballots in favor of the tentative agreement, according to results posted by the union online. The deal was struck last week by...
description: A majority of unionized workers who have voted so far at several major General Motors factories are backing a new labor contract—an encouraging sign for an end to the six-week United Auto Workers strike.
